author: afdudley
content:
> If a dapp requires old data, then that dapp can just request a "pay $0.5 for a package of old data access" permission
I am trying to get a beta version of this out the door this month, we have all the pieces, getting them into production has been slower than expected.

author: afdudley
content: we are using connext and eth to charge for the bytes.

author: .vbuterin
content: It would be nice if we can nudge the ecosystem to "the base network only guarantees 3 months, you need some other thing to go beyond that" fairly soon

author: trent_vanepps
content: <@!273808422753796097> methinks that applications / developers will not make the switch until they are forced to

author: .vbuterin
content: Ideally it's not apps that would need to switch but clients; we can keep the API the same

author: trent_vanepps
content: ah i misunderstood, i was thinking how some apps depend on logs, maybe this isn't related
